repnme.cdata!:
Tunisia - Industrial and Trade Policy
            Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed Loan would support the
            first phase of implementation of the Government's
            program of industrial and trade policy reforms, within the
            framework of a general macro-economic restructuring program.
            The Government's macro-economic restructuring program
            is focusing on measures to limit growth of domestic demand ,
            to stimulate growth of non-traditional exports and to
            improve the allocation and use of scarce economic resources.
            It should also result in a more rapid creation of new
            employment and reduced underemployment. The foreign exchange
            provided by the Loan would be used to finance general
            imports based on a negative list and technical assistance
            for a study of productivity standards. The reforms supported
            by the proposed Loan are expected to create a more favorable
            environment for overall economic and sectoral growth at a
            time of resource constraints.
